channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Lapid bill seeks monthly social pension for PWDs
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: Under Senate Bill No. 1506, all indigent PWDs, as verified and certified by the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) and the National Council on Disability Affairs (NCDA) are entitled to a monthly pension of P2,000.

item.title: 'Ambo' hardly moving, seen to weaken into low pressure area by Monday
item.description: Tropical Storm Ambo (International name Vongfong) is forecast to weaken into a low pressure area within the next 12 to 24 hours, state weather bureau Pagasa said Sunday.

item.title: Use technology, education sector urged
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: The education sector should innovate on the conduct of teaching and learning while adhering to physical distancing protocols and other measures set by the government to curb the spread of coronavirus disease 2019, Sen. Bong Go said yesterday.

item.title: DPWH resumes work on NCR flagship projects
item.author: Jose Rodel Clapano
item.description: Construction work on flagship projects of the Department of Public Works and Highways in the National Capital Region have resumed.

item.title: DOLE: Returning OFWs may avail of P20,000 assistance
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: Returning overseas Filipino worker may avail of some P20,000 in assistance from the Department of Labor and Employment to put up a small business in the country.

item.title: Courts to resume physical operations
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: All courts in areas under general community quarantine will start to operate tomorrow, the Supreme Court said Friday.

item.title: Task Force: Let wives cut your hair
item.author: Jose Rodel Clapano
item.description: Men who really want to have their hair cut should look to stylists very close to home: their wives.

item.title: DepEd to implement safe back-to-school program
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: The Department of Education has assured parents and other stakeholders that the safety of students is a priority when classes reopen in the country on Aug. 24.

item.title: Higher pump prices seen
item.author: Danessa Rivera
item.description: Another round of fuel price hikes is set this week as international prices continue to pick up on rising global demand with easing quarantine restrictions across the globe.

item.title: Ambo heads north, leaves at least 2 dead
item.author: Rhodina Villanueva
item.description: Typhoon Ambo yesterday moved north toward the West Philippine Sea, leaving two dead and bringing heavy damage to agriculture, fishery and infrastructure.
